title: Advantages and Disadvantages of Experiments
question_text: There are advantages and disadvantages to conducting experiments. Which of the following does NOT represent a potential disadvantage of trying to conduct an experiment?

choices.text: Conducting an experiment can be very time-consuming and costly.
For ethical reasons, it may not even possible to conduct certain types of experiments.
Experimental research can create situations that are not realistic.
Some experiments (such as those involving medication) can only be completed with a group of volunteers. This may limit how well we are able to generalize our findings to the entire population.
In an experiment, we should control for the effects of outside variables. This can be difficult to do.

solution:
An experiment should control for the effects of outside variables, and while this may be difficult to do at times, it is not a disadvantage of doing an experiment.

Rather, it is what makes an experiment valuable to us! By controlling for outside factors, we can determine whether it really is the treatment that is causing the effect that we observe.

For these reasons, Choice 'E' is the correct answer.

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A', 'B', 'C' and 'D' are incorrect. Each of these choices does identify a valid potential disadvantage of conducting an experiment.
